title: Inside Tirumala dupatta 'scandal': How fake ‚Äòsilk‚Äô entered VIP rituals; probe zeroes in on suppliers

This fraud, involving crores, comes after a previous laddu adulteration row. The TTD has ordered an Anti-Corruption Bureau probe. The dupattas are presented to donors and VIPs, making this a breach of trust and devotional sentiment.

title: 'Under pressure, hands trembling': Rahul takes dig at Shah over Lok Sabha speech ‚Äî watch
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Home Minister Amit Shah of appearing nervous and using foul language during his Lok Sabha speech on electoral reforms. Gandhi challenged Shah to a debate on his press conference allegations, but Shah stated Parliament would not function according to Gandhi's wishes.

title: US‚ÄìPak major arms deal: Trump admin clears sale of F-16 jets to Sharif govt
content: The US has greenlit a significant $686 million arms deal for Pakistan, including F-16 fighter jet upgrades and logistical support. This move aims to enhance Pakistan's counterterrorism capabilities and interoperability with US forces. The approval follows a recent $93 million US arms sale to India, featuring Javelin missiles and Excalibur rounds, bolstering its defense against regional threats.

title: Goa club fire tragedy: Luthra brothers detained in Thailand; photo shows siblings handcuffed
content: Brothers linked to a deadly Goa nightclub fire are reportedly in Thailand, with Indian authorities seeking their deportation. The Ministry of External Affairs is reviewing a request to revoke their passports as the duo seeks transit anticipatory bail, claiming a business trip and no personal knowledge of the blaze.

title: ‚ÄòWorth thousand words‚Äô: Democrat points to PM Modi‚ÄìPutin car photo in US Congress
content: A carpooling photo of Prime Minister Modi and President Putin became a talking point in the US Congress, highlighting concerns over the Trump administration's India policy. Representative Sydney Kamlager-Dove criticized past actions, stating that coercive partnerships damage crucial alliances. She emphasized the urgent need to mend the US-India partnership for mutual prosperity and global leadership.

title: Trump on $1m gold card: Apple will be happy; nobody talked about it more than Tim Cook
content: President Trump unveiled a 'gold card' visa, offering expedited U.S. residency for a $1 million contribution. This program aims to attract global talent and investors, with Apple CEO Tim Cook reportedly highlighting the need for such a solution. Approved applicants will receive EB-1 or EB-2 visa status, fast-tracking their path to citizenship.

title: ‚ÄòMuch better, more powerful‚Äô: Trump Gold Card vs Green Card; key differences explained
content: President Trump launched the "Trump Gold Card" visa program, offering legal status and a path to citizenship for a $1 million investment. Corporations can pay $2 million per foreign employee. This initiative, with various tiers and significant fees, aims to attract capital while providing expedited residency.

title: BCCI AGM: Board to review women's domestic pay; Virat‚ÄìRohit contract grading on agenda
content: Indian women cricketers' domestic match fees are set for a crucial review at the BCCI's December 22 Apex Council meeting. This follows India's World Cup success and growing calls for better financial support. The meeting will also address men's central contracts, with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's grading under scrutiny.

title: IndiGo crisis: How many flights were cancelled today? Check ticket prices on major routes
content: IndiGo's extensive flight cancellations continue into a second week, impacting thousands of passengers nationwide. The airline's chairman apologized, citing external experts to address root causes and prevent future disruptions. Regulators and the government have intervened, with IndiGo's CEO summoned to present operational stabilization plans, including accelerated pilot hiring.

title: H-1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
content: US Embassy India has warned visa applicants against attending appointments on previously scheduled dates, as interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules. H-1B visa interviews, including those for dependents, are being pushed back as far as next summer, impacting foreign workers' return to the US.

title: ‚ÄòHow can a cop disappear?‚Äô: UP inspector missing after fight with wife; mother moves HC
content: A distraught mother seeks the Allahabad High Court's help to find her son, a UP Police inspector who disappeared on September 17. Allegations of being picked up by Aligarh cops and a delayed missing person report have fueled her desperation. A mutilated body found on railway tracks is now suspected to be the missing inspector, with a DNA test pending.

title: AB de Villiers backs Gambhir's bold call; says white-ball line-ups must stay 'creative'
content: India's ODI series win against South Africa has ignited a debate on batting flexibility, with head coach Gautam Gambhir and former star AB de Villiers advocating for adaptable batting orders. They believe that beyond the openers, players should be ready to bat anywhere to keep teams unpredictable and exploit game situations.

title: Government ‚Äòright‚Äô on SIM binding: Airtel, Jio tell WhatsApp, others; give 7 reasons why
content: India's Department of Telecommunications mandates SIM-binding for messaging apps like WhatsApp, requiring users to maintain their original SIM for registration. This move, effective February 2026, aims to curb spam and fraud, though industry bodies like BIF raise concerns about feasibility and privacy. COAI, however, defends the measure as a crucial security safeguard.

title: Romeo Lane fire: North Goa bans fireworks in nightclubs, hotels, tourist spots
content: Following a devastating nightclub fire that killed 25, Goa's district administration has banned fireworks in tourist establishments. The government also ordered cancellation of licenses for non-compliant venues and prohibited liquor sales after 11 pm, reinforcing safety measures for the upcoming festive season.

title: Ind vs SA: Pressure on Shubman Gill to deliver; team backs him to open over Samson
content: Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma face the challenge of proving themselves as a formidable T20I opening pair against South Africa. Despite Sanju Samson's strong performances, Gill has been reinstated as opener, with management citing his vice-captaincy. Gill's recent T20I form has been underwhelming, and he needs to find a balance between anchoring and matching Abhishek's aggressive style.

title: Paige Shiver‚Äôs net worth: 55% salary hike and link to Sherrone Moore scandal fuel speculation
content: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Candace Owens hits back as Erika Kirk urges public to stop Charlie Kirk rumors
content: Erika Kirk pleaded for privacy regarding her husband Charlie Kirk's burial site on Fox News, citing fears of grave desecration. However, Candace Owens interpreted this plea as a veiled attack, claiming Kirk's words were directed at her. Owens continues to promote unverified theories about Kirk's assassination, despite official reports pointing to a lone gunman.

title: Venus Williams & Andrea Preti net worth 2025: Career, family & business
content: Venus Williams boasts an estimated $95 million net worth in 2025, primarily from her legendary tennis career and successful fashion and design businesses. Her partner, Andrea Preti, an actor and businessman, contributes an estimated $1-2 million. Together, their combined net worth is approximately $96-97 million, reflecting their individual financial achievements.

title: What is Trump's Gold Card? Eligibility, benefits, price and how to apply - FAQs answered
content: Donald Trump launched the "Trump Gold Card," a new program offering legal status and a pathway to US citizenship for individuals and corporations making significant financial contributions. The initiative aims to raise billions for the US Treasury and retain valuable talent, with individual applicants paying $1 million and corporations $2 million per sponsored employee.

title: Anupam Kher praises Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna and others for 'Dhurandhar' - video
content: Veteran actor Anupam Kher has lauded Ranveer Singh's film 'Dhurandhar', calling it 'unbelievably amazing' and a triumph for Indian cinema. He praised Aditya Dhar's powerful storytelling, the cast's strong performances, and the film's tribute to unsung national heroes. Kher highlighted its beautiful weaving of incidents and the neighboring country's role, emphasizing its importance for India.

title: 'Keep problems aside': Smriti Mandhana's first appearance after wedding cancelled ‚Äî watch
content: India's cricket star and World Cup-winning batter Smriti Mandhana spoke about her passion for the game.  She emphasised that wearing the Indian jersey brings immense focus.  Mandhana shared her journey and the lessons learned from cricket.  She highlighted the importance of playing for teammates.  Her commitment to the sport remains strong.

title: ‚ÄòAishwarya and I approached court for our daughter‚Äô: Abhishek Bachchan breaks silence on HC orders protecting family‚Äôs personality rights
content: Abhishek Bachchan revealed he sought court protection for his daughter's rights first, citing online "nasty, unnecessary things." This led to him and Aishwarya securing their personality rights, followed by his father's. Bachchan now urges other public figures to consider similar legal steps due to AI blurring digital boundaries and potential misuse of likeness.

title: ‚ÄòThis is murder‚Äô: Truck rams vehicle of Sandeshkhali rape case witness; kin allege driver was 'known'
content: A key witness in Sandeshkhali land-grab cases narrowly escaped death when a truck rammed his car, killing his son and driver. The family alleges the "accident" was a plot by jailed accused Sheikh Shahjahan. Police are investigating all angles, including sabotage, while political leaders demand justice and a change of venue for trials.

title: Myanmar military strike on hospital leaves 31 dead; civil war intensifies
content: A Myanmar military airstrike on a hospital in Mrauk-U killed at least 31 people and wounded 68 amid a widening offensive ahead of elections. This incident follows another deadly airstrike on a tea shop last week, highlighting the ongoing conflict since the 2021 coup.

title: ‚ÄòRemove the leopard!‚Äô MLA‚Äôs 'wild stunt' triggers commotion during Maha assembly - watch
content: An MLA caused a stir in the Maharashtra assembly by wearing a leopard costume. This was to protest the growing human-leopard conflict. Seven people were injured in a leopard attack in Nagpur the same day. The MLA argued for immediate capture of leopards in dangerous situations. He criticized the forest department's ineffective projects.

title: Trump's $1m ‚ÄòGold Card‚Äô visa unveiled: What applicants stand to gain; what remains off-limits
content: President Trump launched a "gold card" immigration program, allowing individuals and companies to gain legal residency and eventual citizenship by investing $1-2 million. This initiative aims to attract top global talent, particularly graduates from US universities, while generating revenue for the government.

title: Karma returns: Bengaluru thief mugged, robbed of his loot; goes on crime spree to avoid bad luck
content: A Bengaluru thief, after a burglary, was robbed of his loot by four youths. Believing this brought bad luck, he committed two more burglaries to recover his losses. Police later arrested the thief and the four youths, recovering some of the stolen items.

title: Two Indian-origin cricketers picked in Australia's squad for U-19 World Cup
content: Australia has announced its 15-member squad for the ICC Men's U-19 World Cup, featuring two Indian-origin players, Aryan Sharma and John James, who impressed in recent tours. The defending champions' squad, led by Oliver Peake, also includes players of Sri Lankan and Chinese heritage, reflecting Australia's multicultural cricketing landscape.

title: RSS steps into Thiruparankundram storm: Mohan Bhagwat says issue must end ‚Äòfavourably for Hindus‚Äô, no escalation needed for now
content: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat expressed confidence that the Thiruparankundram temple issue in Tamil Nadu can be resolved locally through the strength of Hindus. He stated that while the matter is sub-judice, the awakening of Hindus in the state is sufficient for a favorable outcome. Bhagwat assured that escalation would not be necessary, but Hindu organizations are prepared if needed.

title: Watch: Video shows moment forces seized tanker off Venezuela coast
content: The United States has seized a large oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, President Trump announced, marking a significant escalation in pressure on Nicol√°s Maduro's regime. The tanker, involved in transporting sanctioned oil from Venezuela and Iran, was targeted by a seizure warrant executed by federal agencies.

title: Salman moves Delhi HC seeking protection of personality rights
content: Bollywood superstar Salman Khan has moved the Delhi High Court seeking protection of his personality and publicity rights, joining a growing list of public figures, such as Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, Kumar Sanu, Nagarjuna and Jr NTR, pushing back against the unauthorised commercial use of celebrity identity.

title: 'I really believe in myself': Calm Hardik Pandya makes maximum impact vs SA
content: Hardik Pandya's composed 59 off 28 balls in the first T20I against South Africa highlighted his crucial role in India's white-ball setup. Returning from injury, Pandya displayed a calm demeanor, stabilizing the innings and providing much-needed power hitting in the middle order. His ability to absorb pressure and bat with a high strike rate without compromising team needs was evident.

title: US Federal Reserve cuts rate: What does it mean for Indian stock markets? Explained
content: The US Federal Reserve has enacted its third consecutive rate cut, lowering borrowing costs to a three-year low. While this move is generally seen as positive for Indian markets by easing global liquidity and potentially boosting foreign investment, experts caution that domestic factors will ultimately dictate the impact.

title: Guwahati: Foreign tourist alleges harassment at Post Malone concert; police reach out
content: A foreign tourist alleged harassment and unwanted touching at Post Malone's Guwahati concert. She posted about the incident on Instagram, stating she and a friend felt unsafe within minutes of entering the crowded venue. Guwahati police have reached out for details but received no response. The tourist clarified the incident doesn't reflect the city's hospitality.

title: Ferrari spirals out of control, slams lamp post in Kolkata, splits in two; 4 hurt
content: A high-end Ferrari crashed on Hospital Road near Victoria Memorial, injuring at least four people, two critically. The driver, Amrit Singh Saini, and a PWD staffer, Rashida Bibi, are among the seriously injured. Police are investigating the cause, with speed and potential driving lessons being considered. The car was reportedly travelling at excessive speed before losing control.

title: Didn't engineer chaos to bypass pilot rest rules: IndiGo chairman
content: IndiGo's chairman, Vikram Singh Mehta, apologized for recent flight disruptions, denying they were deliberate. He stated external experts will identify root causes to prevent future chaos. Mehta clarified that the airline followed new pilot rest rules and did not compromise safety. A combination of internal and external factors, not intentional actions, pushed systems beyond limits, causing cancellations.

title: Drake Maye clears up confusion, reveals the real name fans should use for wife Ann Michae
content: Ann Michael Maye, wife of Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, is becoming a social media star. Her baking videos, especially her 'Bakemas' series, are a hit with fans. Patriots supporters in Boston have given her the nickname 'Queen of the North'. Drake Maye expressed pride in his wife's growing popularity. Ann Michael prefers her full name, Ann Michael, not just Ann.

title: 'Dhurandhar' Day 6: Ranveer, Akshaye, R Madhavan starrer nears Rs 200 crore mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is making waves at the box office, surpassing previous releases within its first six days. The action-drama is on track to hit the Rs 200 crore milestone, with strong weekday collections indicating its continued success. The film is also garnering positive reviews, with Ranvir Shorey praising it as a 'kicka** spy thriller'.

title: Hrithik, Akshay review Ranveer‚Äôs Dhurandhar: 'I may disagree with the politics but...'
content: Ranveer Singh‚Äôs Dhurandhar continues its dominating run at the box office, comfortably crossing the Rs 150-crore mark within its first week. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the espionage thriller has not only impressed audiences but is also drawing strong reactions from within the industry. After several filmmakers and actors praised the film, the latest to react are Akshay Kumar and Hrithik Roshan ‚Äî both offering detailed and impactful responses to the film.

title: Can Sharjeel, Umar speeches be deemed terror acts? Supreme Court asks cops
content: The Supreme Court questioned Delhi Police on invoking stringent UAPA provisions against riot accused for speeches, seeking justification for linking terror acts to their words.  Justices sought clarity on how Section 15, pertaining to terrorist acts, applies when arms weren't directly used by the accused, who have been jailed for over five years.

title: 'Want to play T20 World Cup': Jaiswal opens up amid Gill‚Äôs poor form
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal revealed that the Indian dressing room feels unsettled when Rohit Sharma doesn't scold younger players, as his reprimands are always affectionate. Jaiswal highlighted the inspirational presence of Rohit and Virat Kohli, who share valuable experiences and guidance. He also expressed his ambition to lead India one day.

title: Goa club fire erupts 11.45pm; accused book Thailand tickets at 1.17am; court says no to relief
content: Owners of a Goa nightclub where 25 died in a fire sought transit anticipatory bail in Delhi, claiming they were on "official work" in Thailand. Goa police objected, stating the brothers booked flights after the blaze began. Interpol has issued a blue corner notice against them.

title: IPL: Punjab Kings' auction preview ‚Äì Iyer‚Äôs settled side enter with few gaps to fill
content: Punjab Kings, IPL 2025 runners-up, enter the 2026 auction with a settled squad and Rs 11.50 crore purse. They aim to fill gaps in wicket-keeping and spin bowling, potentially targeting overseas keeper-batters like Jonny Bairstow or Tim Seifert, and spin all-rounders to bolster their title aspirations.

title: Market engulfed in flames in Russia's St Petersburg; several explosions heard - video
content: A devastating fire has engulfed one of St. Petersburg's major markets, with reports of explosions. The blaze, which broke out Wednesday night in the Nevsky district, has tragically claimed one life and injured two others. Thick smoke billowed over the city as the entire market complex is believed to be consumed by flames.

title: Taking a bite from the chocolate bar? It could affect your aging process, new study suggests
content: New research suggests a compound in dark chocolate, theobromine, may slow biological aging. Scientists observed a link between higher theobromine levels and younger cellular markers in adults. While promising, researchers caution against viewing dark chocolate as a miracle cure, emphasizing a balanced lifestyle remains key for longevity.

title: Congress brass behind poll defeats, not EVMs: Amit Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah strongly refuted opposition claims of "vote chori," attributing Congress's defeats to leadership failures. He defended electoral roll revisions and challenged allegations of institutional capture by the RSS. Shah highlighted past instances of alleged vote manipulation by Congress leaders and accused the opposition of opposing national interests.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Petr Yan's upset win disrupts nearly the entire top 10
content: Petr Yan beats merab Dvalishvili at UFC 323 on saturday . the victory put him back in the pound-for-pound rankings and disrupted practically the entire men's top 10 . there was not a clear consensus among voters as to where the top fighters belong .

title: Who's No. 1 in the boys' 2026, 2027, 2028 recruiting classes?
content: the top spot in a class's player rankings is never owned -- merely rented -- and this cycle remains as competitive as ever . our evaluations lean on guiding questions: who is the best player today? who drives winning at the high school level? who projects as a future star on a top-25 college team, or a high-end NBA draft pick?

title: Rankings for Week 15
content:
Tristan H. Cockcroft explains what makes Joe Burrow a great quarterback option for the remainder of the fantasy season. (1:06) ESPN's weekly PPR and IDP  fantasy football  rankings are an aggregate of our rankers (eight PPR, three IDP). They are Matt Bowen, Mike Clay, Tristan H. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. Rankings will be published every Tuesday and are updated throughout the week for news and emerging analysis. PPR rankings:

title: The first 'Hail Mary': An iconic Cowboys moment and a 50-year Vikings beef
content: quarterback and wide receiver Hall of Famers were among the former players on hand . the cowboys celebrated the 50th anniversary of the most memorable play in Cowboys history . quarterback, wide receiver, hall of famers among those on hand at the time .

title: Buzz: Is Josh Allen or Dak Prescott the more consistent QB?
content: only four quarterbacks have delivered a top-10 weekly positional point total on as many as eight occasions . the only one who has finished among the top 10 quasts has finished . a fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with intel they need .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .
